thread.title: As Kilauea Rages, a Look at the Diverse Volcanic Vocabulary

author: Ben Zimmer
title: As Kilauea Rages, a Look at the Diverse Volcanic Vocabulary
text:
As Hawaii’s Kilauea volcano continues to erupt, threatening residents of the Big Island with ash, toxic gas and even lava bombs, a special kind of volcanic lingo has been spewing forth as well.
For a few weeks now, the U.S. Geological Survey has been warning of the risks of “vog,” short for “volcanic smog,” the hazy air pollution caused by noxious emissions like sulfur dioxide gas interacting with oxygen, sunlight and moisture in the atmosphere. A whole website is even devoted to providing information about the dangers of...
